Name: Pattern Recognition - IND
Text: Let me understand the DECLARE model provided init R existence C responded existence E activities A precedence C activities R noncoexistence E activities C

Name: Deductive Reasoning - PE
Text: In DECLARE responded existence means if A occurs then E must occur precedence means R must precede C noncoexistence means E and C cannot both occur in the same trace

Name: Inductive Reasoning - PE
Text: The intended process flow is R A E P N C so all activities should happen in sequence both E and C should be present

Name: Hypothesis Generation - IND
Text: Assume responded existence means if A occurs E must occur based on common DECLARE usage

Name: Deductive Reasoning - PE
Text: Noncoexistence between E and C contradicts the intended flow where both should be present if A occurs E must occur but C must occur and cannot coexist with E clear contradiction

Name: Abductive Reasoning - PE
Text: Possible reasons misinterpretation of business requirements leading to contradictory rules incremental changes in policies not reflected consistently technical issues or incomplete data pressure to handle claims quickly allowing skipping steps

Name: Validation - PE
Text: Suggest SQL queries to check anomalies find claims closed without evaluation find traces where E and C coexist find claims where A occurs but E does not

Name: Heuristic Reasoning - IND
Text: Structure the response with sections for anomalies identification hypotheses and verification approaches with SQL queries
